name: Roast Turkey
description: Bon Appétit style roast turkey with a dry rub and sherry vinegar glaze.
ingredients: 2 Tbsp. whole pink or black peppercorns
½ cup Diamond Crystal or ¼ cup plus 1½ tsp. Morton kosher salt
1 Tbsp. plus ⅓ cup (packed) light brown sugar
Small handful of hardy herbs (such as sage, rosemary, bay leaves, and/or thyme)
⅓ cup sherry vinegar or red wine vinegar
6 Tbsp. neutral oil (such as vegetable, peanut, or canola)
instructions: Turkey Prep (1-2 days prior): Place turkey, breast side up, on a cutting board and pat dry. Remove wings and legs. Remove backbone (spatchcock style or separated pieces).
Dry Rub: Grind peppercorns and mix with salt, garlic powder, onion powder, paprika, and 1 Tbsp brown sugar.
Rub the turkey pieces liberally with salt mixture. Chill bird, uncovered, at least 24 hours and up to 2 days.
Day of cooking (Glaze): Combine orange zest, crushed garlic, 1/3 cup brown sugar, soy sauce, sherry vinegar, and herbs in a small saucepan.
Cook mixture over medium heat for 10–12 minutes until sugar is dissolved and glaze thickens slightly.
Preheat oven to 425°. Rub turkey with oil and pour 1 cup water into baking sheet.
Roast turkey until skin is mostly golden brown, 20–25 minutes.
Reduce oven temperature to 300° and continue to roast turkey for 50–70 minutes, brushing with glaze every 20 minutes.
